member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Destroys this instance.

member.summary: Takes an I420 buffer, encodes and returns a openh264 buffer.

member.name: M:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Native.Decode(FM.LiveSwitch.VideoBuffer,FM.LiveSwitch.VideoFormat)

member.name: T:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Utility
member.summary: OpenH264-related utility functions.

member.name: M:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Utility.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes OpenH264 native libraries.

member.name: M:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Utility.IsSupported
member.summary: Determines whether this platform can run OpenH264.

member.name: M:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Utility.GetDownloadUrl
member.summary: Gets the url for the OpenH264 library needed for this platform.

member.name: M:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Utility.GetLibraryName
member.summary: Gets the filename for the OpenH264 library for this platform.

member.name: M:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Utility.GetLoadLibraryName
member.summary: Gets the filename that should be used to load the OpenH264 library. This may be different than the return value from GetLibraryName() if a symlink must be used to load the library.

member.name: M:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Utility.DownloadOpenH264
member.summary: Checks if the current OpenH264 native library exists in the expected location. If so, return without doing anything. If not, then the current version will be downloaded from Cisco to that location. If an older version of the library is detected, it will be removed before downloading the new version. Not supported in UWP.

member.name: M:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Utility.DownloadOpenH264(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the current OpenH264 native library exists in the expected location. If so, return without doing anything. If not, then the current version will be downloaded from Cisco to that location. If an older version of the library is detected, it will be removed before downloading the new version. Not supported in UWP.
member.param: The location to download the OpenH264 library to. Should normally be left empty to allow the correct path to be chosen automatically. But for Android, it should point to the application directory.

member.name: M:FM.LiveSwitch.OpenH264.Utility.DownloadOpenH264(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the current OpenH264 native library exists in the expected location. If so, return without doing anything. If not, then the current version will be downloaded from Cisco to that location. Not supported in UWP.
member.param: The location to download the OpenH264 library to. Should normally be left empty to allow the correct path to be chosen automatically. But for Android, it should point to the application directory.
If true, and if a new version of OpenH264 is required, this method will clean up the existing older library.
